ISRAELI LITERATURE, WRITTEN IN ENGLISH, OR TRANSLATED FROM HEBREW TO ENGLISH:

WL Reads recently interviewed Julie Zuckerman about her series of short stories, The Book of Jeremiah. She creates and hosts a series of face to face and digitally accessible events, Literary Modiin, so others can listen to and learn about Israeli authors who choose to write in English.Lit Modiin | Julie Zuckerman, Author Her monthly newsletter where Julia shares some book titles and explains her recommendations and recipes.: Julie Zuckerman’s Monthly Author Newsletter | Substack

From Mercaz: recordings and summaries of interviews with Israeli authors. Mercaz Reads Israel Archives – MERCAZ USA

WL Reads suggested book written by Israeli authors:

Zeruya Shalev

Yochi Brandes

Orly Castel-Bloom (Textile)

Savyon Liebrecht

Ayelet Tsabari

Ayelet Gundar-Goshen

Yaniv Iczkovits.

Two Non-Fiction Titles:

The Mossad Amazons, authored by Dr. Michael Bar-Zohar. This book is a historical narration of the amazing women in the Israeli Secret Service. For more information, consider contacting Nilly Ovnat, VP Magal Books Magalbooks.literary@gmail.com .

Women on the Front Lines: Inside the Combat Units of the Israeli Army, authored by Debbie Zimelman, resident of Modi’in. Photos enhance the collection of interviews to give us a deep and rich appreciation of this unique experience. You can reach her debsu.zim@gmail.com .
